Television set

A device that plays DVDs

An oven using microwaves to cook or heat food quickly
I heat my lunch in the microwave.

tablet
A portable PC, typically with a touchscreen display
Children often use a tablet to play games.

digital camera
A camera that records images in digital form
I bought a new digital camera for my trip.
Poseer / Ser dueño de
own
To possess; have something as one's own
Which of these items do you own?
Todos los días
every day
Happening or used each day
Which devices do you use every day?
Artículos / Objetos
items
Individual articles or units
Which items are the most useful?
Útil
useful
Able to be used for a practical purpose
A smart phone is very useful.
Clasificar / Ordenar
rank
To give (someone or something) a rank or place within a grading system
Please rank the items from most to least useful.
Promedio
average
A standard or level considered typical or usual
A child watches TV for an average of X hours.
Por ciento
percent
By a specified amount in or for every hundred
More than X percent of children have a TV.
Niños de escuela primaria
primary school children
Children attending the first stage of compulsory education
Primary school children often watch cartoons.
Dormitorio / Habitación
bedroom
A room for sleeping in
Many children have a TV in their bedroom.
Pasar (tiempo)
spend (time)
To pass time in a specified way or place
The average person spends X years watching TV.
Menores de tres años
under three years old
Children younger than the age of three
Children under three years old watch a lot of TV.
Concentrarse
concentrating
Focusing all one's attention on a particular object or activity
TV may cause problems concentrating at school.
Conversaciones significativas
meaningful conversations
Discussions that are serious, important, or useful
Families spend little time having meaningful conversations.
Por semana
per week
For each week
How many hours do you watch TV per week?
Demasiado
too much
An excessive amount
Do you think watching 5 hours a day is too much?
No suficiente
not enough
Less than the required or desired amount
Maybe watching only 1 hour per week is not enough.
Información del programa
programme information
Details about a TV show or documentary
Read the programme information first.
Quitados / Retirados
taken away
Removed from a person's possession
Their televisions and video games are taken away.
Padres
parents
A person's father or mother
How do you think the parents will feel?
Sentir(se)
feel
To experience an emotion or sensation
How will the parents feel during the experiment?
Experimento
experiment
A scientific procedure undertaken to test a hypothesis or demonstrate a fact
The documentary shows families in an experiment.
Serie documental
documentary series
A series of documentary films or programmes
Panorama is a BBC documentary series.
Analiza / Examina
looks at
Considers or examines something
The series looks at important issues.
Asuntos / Temas
issues
Important topics or problems for debate or discussion
It looks at important issues like the effect of TV on kids.
Familias
families
Groups consisting of parents and children living together
Several families have to live without TV.
Vivir sin
live without
To manage or survive in the absence of something typically available
They have to live without televisions, computers and video games.
Sobrevivir
survive
To continue to live or exist, especially in spite of danger/hardship
Can the families survive without technology?
Aprender de
learn from
To gain knowledge or skill from an experience
What can we learn from the experiment?
Engordar
get fat
To become overweight
Do children who watch too much TV get fat?
Escuela secundaria
secondary school
School attended after primary school
The programme went to a secondary school.
Hogares
homes
The place where one lives permanently
They took microwaves out of the homes of children.
Mitad
half
Either of two equal or corresponding parts into which something is divided
Half the children in the class participated.
Grabar
record
To convert sound or vision into a permanent form for later reproduction
They gave the children a camera to record events.
Trabajar más duro
work harder
To put more effort into one's job or tasks
The parents had to work harder without TVs.
Misma cantidad
same amount
An equal quantity or number
They watched the same amount of TV as before.
Mantener entretenidos a los niños
keep children entertained
To provide children with amusement or enjoyment
